inn1.comm: good length ball outside off, Smith steps forward and leaves
too straight from Finn, full and on middle and Smith swings that bottom hand through a leg-side clump for four
pitched up a little more towards off stump, pushed between point and cover
full, around the line of off, whipped to leg again but this time straight at midwicket
length ball pushed through wide of the stumps, Smith leaves
beats the outside edge this time with a lifter speared through in the corridor outside off, Smith fending on the back foot
wide of the stump and back of a length, bit of a loosener, Amla mistimes a cut towards point
angled in on a length, off-stump line, defended
bit if width, seams away as Amla stays back and swings from the hip, beaten past the outside edge
pitched up and punched into the covers on the front foot
length ball, on the stumps, closes the face and turns into the leg side
beautiful shot through the covers to get Amla off the mark, not much foot movement but he middles a drive on the up for four
length ball angled across and defended on the front foot
touch wider, Smith opens the face and edges low towards slip
pushed to mid-off and they steal one as Cook comes in to field
slides down the leg side - that'll be a wide
back of a length, still not doing much through the air of off the pitch, left alone outside off
short ball coming back in towards the batsman from outside off, defended to cover
length ball, wide of the stumps and seaming back a touch, Amla shoulders arms
on the pads and clipped through backward square leg
full and straight and again Smith brings his bat down like an executioner's axe to chop through square
drags his length back, angled across and tapped to midwicket on the front foot
better line from Anderson, wide of off and drawing Smith out, he drives a little hesitantly and the ball whistles past the outside edge

oh, that's close! Smith is almost bowled in the same manner of his dismissal in the Oval Test, defending with a closed bat face on to his front pad, the ball rolling between his legs and just past leg stump
pushed across and left alone outside off
length ball outside off and defended back to Finn
good length, wide of off and Amla is hit on the pad trying to flick through the leg side

edged and dropped! Amla flashed at a back-of-a-length ball outside off, got a thick edge to second slip, where Tredwell shelled it! Got his hands in the wrong place and seemed to lose the flight at the last minute
full and wide and sliced to third man via a low outside edge
round the wicket to Smith, length ball in the corridor and left alone
pitched up a little more, shaping away and Smith steps out and leaves
short and slightly wide, steered to point with an open bat face
back of a length outside off and chopped to cover, playing back
length ball, speared across and shaping away from the left-hander, no stroke
angled across wide of the stumps, Smith follows it on the walk and tries to tuck the ball into the leg side, hit on the thigh pad
length ball outside the line of off, pushed into the covers this time
more width, touch short from Anderson and Smith cuts, thickish edge flies low through gully and Finn does well to prevent four at third man
beaten outside off, rare false stroke from Amla (ignoring all the edges England have dropped), pushing at a shorter ball that left him off the pitch
coming back in this time and hits Amla on the knee roll, it was going over the stumps but good bowling from Finn
cracking response from Amla, hooking a tracer bullet wide of the diving midwicket fielder, the ball scorching a trail to the boundary rope
pitched up outside off stump, punched back past the bowler for a single to mid-on
round the wicket, length ball around the line of off, defended back to the bowler
shorter length, tight line and Smith blocks on the back foot
length ball outside off, pushed into the off side
Amla shuffles right across his stumps to take a length ball from outside off and flick it long leg for a couple
pitched up outside off and defended on the front foot
good length and in the channel, again Amla tries to take it through the leg side and is hit on the knee roll outside the line of off
persistent line from Anderson, turned to midwicket
back of a length outside off, stays back and chopped to mid-on
defended on the back foot outside off
bit more width, drives and squirts a low edge through gully to the man on the fence
touch short of a length in the corridor of befuddlement and Amla plays and misses on the back foot
gets forward to defend a length ball towards cover

hit on the front pad, length ball and it seams back in ... and England review the not-out decision. However, Finn's height means the bouncer would have taken it over, enough seam movement to send it down leg too, so England have now played their one DRS card
another in-ducker on a length beats Amla flick to leg and hits the pad above the knee roll and probably outside off too
length delivery outside the line of off, left alone by Smith
full and slightly wide of the stumps, attempted drive doesn't connect cleanly and mid-off fields
Smith advances, and early hop out of the crease, then tries to cut a short, wide ball and bottom-edges into the ground towards the slips
another very wide delivery, Smith throws his bat it it and gets a thick bottom edge past the wicketkeeper for four
back of a length, tighter line and tapped to point
full and wide of off, still trying to drag Smith into his discomfort zone, slashed to cover on the drive
full and wide of the stumps, Amla jams his bat down and tabs to point
pitched up around the line of off, dropped into the covers for one
low full toss outside off, punched back to the bowler on the full and Bopara then throws down the stumps as Smith hastily returns to his crease
length ball clipped through the leg side for one
big offcutter and Amla is thumping on the knee roll, again umpire Illingworth shakes his head - it came back a long way from outside off but Hawk Eye reckons it would have thumped into leg stump
length ball and this rise and seams away from Smith, who is beating dabbling away from his body
fullish length, sliding down the leg side and Amla lofts this over mid-on, not quite where he was aiming but there's enough bat on it to clear the infield
length ball on the pads, clipped through square
slower ball out the back of the hand, Smith doesn't pick it and end up being through his shot early, patting the ball back down the track
wide of the off stump, on a length and tapped to mid-off
shorter length, Smith stays back and guides one to third man
seaming in towards the stumps on a good length, whipped through midwicket with a flick of the wrists
length ball played back to the bowler
bit of width, full and enticing the drive, Amla gets a thick edge to third man, no slip in place for Bopara currently
back of a length and angled across, steered off the face of the bat to third man
pitched up and driven through the covers
full and around the line of off, Smith brings the bat down to shovel through square leg
back of a length in the corridor, dropped short on the leg side and they take one
tossed up on off, played back to the bowler
length ball, spinning and straightening, driven back down the pitch
full and flighted on middle and off, punched back and fielded by Patel
tossed up outside the line of off, gets out and pushes through the covers to the sweeper
round the wicket to Smith, full and outside off, punched to mid-off
touch short and Smith steps out, the ball spins quite a way back from outside off and the batsman plays it late, down on to Kieswetter's boot and he fields
pitched up outside off and punched towards cover
full and straight, driven to mid-on and they successfully take on Cook's arm
length ball angled across, bit of unexpected lift off the pitch and Smith's waft is beaten past the outside edge
back of a length and fiddled towards point, not quite what he was trying to do
opens the face and steers a length ball to third man
pitched up on off stump and driven back to Bopara
tossed up just outside off, paddle swept to leg for an easy single
whipped via midwicket from a full length outside off
played with the spin to leg hanging back
full and slapped down the ground
turn there for Patel, this strikes the pad as Smith looked to move it to leg again
well outside off, swept at and missed
length ball that nips back and strikes the thigh pad, they take a single towards point
back of a length and angled down to third man
a length ball again, off the pad outside off and it runs into the off side
good length ball again, this a little straighter so it's worked down to long leg

dropped again! Can you Adam and Eve it! It's a genuine nick from a fuller ball and Tredwell at first slip has allowed this straight through his hands, Kieswetter did dive across him but I think Tredwell has seen that all the way and doesn't get anywhere near catching it really
straight again and tucked down to long leg
length ball just outside off, pushed to point
full length and Amla times the pants off it over long off all the way for six, a fraction full and played really well, a good stride down the wicket and the full blade through the ball
back of a length just outside off, worked wide of mid on on the back foot
step across the off stump, tried to be played to the on-side but only an edge into the ground
length with width offered, chopped down to third man, timed well but straight to the fielder
slower ball outside off, Amla throws the bat at it and gets it off low on the bat towards cover
just outside off, played back and dropped towards the slip corner
outside off, a shuffle across the stumps and a shovel back to the bowler
back and dropped towards point, Smith calls Amla through for a sharp single
full and driven on the bounce over the bowler, Cook slides at mid off to field
wild waft outside off, played without foot movement, missed
fuller and much straighter, blocked down to mid on

edged and finally England take a chance as Smith top edges a pull through to the keeper. It was a quick bumper that surprised Smith a little, he got in no position to pull to leg and was late on the stroke and got a healthy top edge that Kieswetter took above his head
full ball just outside off, left alone
similar ball and left alone again

full again, this time tighter to the off stump and Duminy edges and gets a nick and it would have been a chance to second slip but England's second catcher is floating about fifth slip, moonlighting as a gully, so well away from the chance that runs for four
this time left outside off stump
length ball now and blocked just outside off stump
blocked into the covers and Bopara does well to throw the stumps down at the strikers end but Duminy got through for the single
way down the leg side
back of a length outside off, pushed towards point
full outside off, a drive in the air that is just past Eoin Morgan diving at backward point
tighter to off stump, left alone
another drive off an outside edge but this is along the ground past point towards third man
wide and left outside off
forward just outside off, punched past extra cover with excellent timing, Bell fields well on the cover fence, sliding to his right to keep them to one
bumper and ducked beneath
fuller and slapped to mid off
full and tighter to off stump, punched with excellent timing past mid on, lovely stroke, textbook
little wider, guided down to third man
tucked down to long leg to a fuller ball on the stumps
too straight and worked behind square on the leg side
outside off, full, guided through cover
blocked into the covers hanging back on off stump
blocked again just outside off stump
jags back down the hill and strikes the body before running towards point
full and driven on the front foot to point
tossed up outside off, driven down to long off
little bit of turn from outside off, played forward off the outer half of the bat
off stump, paddled down to deep backward square
tucked to midwicket playing with the spin
goes down for a big slog sweep, comes off the pad past the wicketkeeper
this time he gets the sweep over square leg, nicely played that, safely from outside off
full just outside off, driven to point
well outside off, missed with the pull, and called wide too
leg stump-ish and strikes the pad and runs into the leg side

cleaned him up! Bit of surprise this, Bopara has tailed one past the attempted off drive of Amla and scattered his stumps. Full and straight, moved in a little and Amla, driving a little loosely was done between bat and pad, middle and leg skittled
played ever so late down to third man on the back foot
full and worked out through cover
outside off and de Villiers goes to play very very late again and gets an inside edge so nearly onto his stumps, runs down to long leg
floated up outside off, flicked to midwicket who slid and saved well
this time de Villiers finds the gap past midwicket

beautifully bowled and Duminy is done like a kipper floated up, Duminy is drawn out of his ground, doesn't get to the pitch and the turn past the attempted flick provides the simplest of stumping chances for Kieswetter, superbly bowled by Tredwell
tossed up outside off, played forward into the covers
stays back this time, flicked to midwicket
turn there into the right hander, blocked around off stump staying back
full and beautifully played down the ground, superb to watch this, on driven to perfection
again the ball tailing in, strikes the batsman on the pad, would have been going down
straighter and played towards long leg, very athletic running brings two
tails in and driven back to the bowler
well outside off and left alone comfortably
full and driven again, this time straight back to the bowler
just outside off, premeditated paddle behind square on the leg side
full and tucked with the spin to midwicket
down the track now and worked to midwicket
swept from outside off, missed and hit the pad
waited for and moved past midwicket out to the sweeper for a single
well outside off and left alone getting right across the stumps
waited for just outside off, guided down to third man in that oh-so-late fashion in which de Villiers generally operates
full and tucked to square leg
back of a length and tucked to midwicket

back to guide to third man and played on trying to run it down to third man, tried to play it like de Villiers but forgot his name is Faf, inside edge onto the stump, almost got down on one knee there and again Bopara's drift into the right hander is decisive
full outside off and blocked coming forward
sliding away outside off and left alone
moved with the turn behind square on the leg side
superbly bowled, grip and turn past the outside edge as Elgar played forward
flighted up again, driven towards cover
floated up again, tucked to midwicket on the front foot
touch shorter, backed away and cut out to deep cover
turned with the spin behind square leg
full and driven down to long off
full again, nudged towards point
middle and leg this time, tucked to midwicket
played very late once more, guided down to third man
full outside off, driven out to deep point
length ball comes off an edge as it's look to be turned
tossed up on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
flighted outside the line of off, blocked into the cover area
goes back, bit of width and cut through point for a couple
looping offbreak outside off stump, prodded back down the track
length ball outside off, worked through the leg side
tossed up outside the line of off, turned through midwicket for one
full and driven back to the bowler from in front of off stump
back of a length outside off, played past the bowler to long-on
full, almost yorker length, punched to mid-off
plays around the front pad to work a length ball through midwicket
outside the line of off, pushed back to the bowler
another nip-backer, on a length and it defeats de Villiers glance, hit on the knee roll and deflects square - and that is time for drinks
tossed up outside off and steered to point
full and spinning in towards off, Elgar goes down on one knee and misses trying to sweep, hit on the front pad well outside the line
stays back and nudges a length ball to midwicket
again looks a bit uncomfortable trying to sweep, flips the ball into the away toward short fine leg
round the wicket to ABdV, length ball, tickled through the covers
tossed up and more spin and bounce, Elgar plays across the line and is again hit on the pad, well outside off though
pitched up on middle and off, rotates the wrists to whip this through square leg
down the leg side, touch short and nudged off the hips to long leg
pitched up outside the line of off, de Villiers plays with a straight bat and drives one to long-on
length ball, slanted across, worked towards mid-on
full and slightly wide, steps out and punches through the covers to Patel sweeping on the boundary
full, almost a leg-stump half-volley, clipped off the pads to deep backward square - a full over of singles
length ball outside off and spinning across, helped down to long leg playing with the turn
round the wicket to de Villiers, tossed up on middle, worked wide of mid-on for one
full and on the stumps, tipped down the ground to long-on
flighted on off stump, de Villiers pushes to extra-cover on the front foot
plays with the spin through the off side, driving to the cover sweeper
floated up outside off, nurdled towards midwicket for another scuttled single
round the wicket, pitching on a length outside off stump, shapes away from Elgar, who leaves
full and wide, swings a bit further and the batsman stretches to drive, misses, and it's called wide
back of a length, plenty of width again, under-edged on to the pitch through to the keeper trying to cut
tighter line, coming back in towards the batsman, who blocks to the on side
touch short of a good length again, wide of the stumps and chopped on the bounce to point
feisty bumper from Finn, homing in on the throat and Elgar does well to get above it and block down on to the pitch
short again, veering down the leg side - another wide
full length, drifting towards leg stump, flicked round the corner for a couple as Anderson comes round from deep backward square
turn for Patel, the ball gripping and straightening in line with off and de Villiers edges low towards point
this one goes on with the arm and is blocked in front of the stumps
tossed up outside of, pushed through the covers
looped up outside off, plenty of air and spinning back in to hit the pad as Elgar tries to play with the spin, outside the line again though
tossed up full on off stump, well worked through square leg for a couple
flighted on off, doesn't get a clean connection and the ball dribbles to midwicket
back of a length outside off, de Villiers gets across but is beaten by the bounce trying to pull and wears this on his forearm
short and well wide of off, ABdV gets very far across to manufacture a pull through midwicket for a couple
stays back in the crease and is beaten on the inside edge by a length ball that nips back a touch and possibly stays low
full of a length, outside the line of off, played via bat and pad short on the off side
short and slightly wide, driven with a angled bat through cover off the back foot
round the wicket to Elgar, slip in place, defends a back of a length ball in front of the wicket
tossed up outside the line of off, whipped through midwicket
round the wicket, full and outside off, pulls between deep midwicket and long-on for a couple
tickled back down the track to long-on
edged, fine and past Kieswetter's gloves, little bit of turn as de Villiers drove but he got just enough on it, Trott does well in the field to prevent four
pushed through on off stump, worked through the leg side on the front foot
tossed up outside off and driven to the fielder in the deep
flighted outside off, de Villiers reverses the bat and sweeps fine past short third man, well place and well timed
tossed up again de Villiers reverse sweeps again, more powerfully this time but closer to the fielder and they pick up one
tossed up outside off, pushed through the covers

advances to play an expansive drive and is stumped! Tredwell maybe dragged the line a bit wider, pushed it through a bit quicker and Kieswetter was quick to pull off his second stumping, de Villiers unable to get his big toe back across the line
round the wicket, slip in place, tossed up and blocked outside off
full length ball on the stumps, driven back to the bowler
flighted in towards the stumps, worked through square leg
pushed through on off stump, played back to the bowler
full, steps out and pushes one down the ground to long-on
flighted around the line of off, worked into the deep towards long-on
spinning in towards the stumps, played on the back foot to long-on for another single
length ball spinning in, hit on the front pad outside the line
nothing slower about this though, lift from back of a length and it flies past the outside edge through to the keeper
forward and pushed to point from off stump

forward press outside off, runs past Trott at extra cover who goes down for the dummy slide but Ian Bell behind him doesn't read it and lets the ball skirt past him also, so they take two, not the sharpest work there
short and wide outside off, too wide
forward and clipped to extra cover
short, Parnell goes to pull and gets a bottom edge to the keeper
slower ball onto middle stump, tucked behind square on the leg side
flatter onto leg stump, hits the pad and runs into the leg side

more big turn and another stumping. Once again Tredwell draws a batsman to drive outside off, the turn beats the outside edge, the back foot slips outside the popping crease and Kieswetter does the rest, lovely stuff from Tredwell
forward just outside off, pushing into the covers
played late around middle and off, blocked on the crease
tossed up, ran into the covers, a suicidal single, easy run out surely, but Anderson can't gather Kieswetter's poor return, it was a terrible run and a huge let off
pushed out through point on the front foot
back of a length outside off, shaping away, felt for and missed
back of a length again, more of a cut this time but missed by a long way again
full outside off, carved past point for a couple to Bell's right on the cover fence
wide of off stump again and again there is no contact as Elgar feels for it a long way away from his body
angled in, struck on the pad too high for the lbw appeal to be satisfied
slower ball outside off, ran to point
I say, a huge long-handelled reversed slog sweep over backward point, lovely strike
goes again and this is into the grandstand, marvellous strike, excellent timing and all the way this time, beautiful
goes for the reverse again so Tredwell fires it down the leg/off side and not called wide and rightly so because Petersen turned himself right-handed
goes again and now adjusts and plays it out to deep cover, remarkable
forward and blocked back to the bowler
another floaty off spinner blocked up the wicket
angled in, off the pads to square leg via the inside edge
short of a length, tucked in front of mid on
went for the pull, got it high on the bat towards midwicket
lifted down the ground for four, no-one at long on so this pick up on-drive goes past the fielder for four, goo stroke
back of a length outside off, guided down to third man
full wide of off stump, ran to point
slower ball, just outside off, picked and heaved away to cow corner, a good strike again from Petersen, good knock this now
across his stumps and flicked to fine leg for four more, really good stuff again, recognised no-one was at home at long leg
full outside off, angled down to third man
fuller and pushed down to long on
slower ball again, waited for and slapped to point
full on leg stump, turned to midwicket
back of a length and a wild cut comes off an edge to fine third man, fortunate but effective
fuller, another swing outside off, missed this time
went for the paddle to leg again but got it wrong from outside off and was struck on the pad, leg bye to cover
back of a length, ended up angling it off the shoulder of the bat to the keeper
short, goes for the pull and gets a glove to the keeper. Tried to help a slower-ball bouncer around the corner but got there too early and provided a simple chance to Kieswetter

angled in and comes off the pads, cry for lbw, it runs to third man and as they come back for the second, third man has thrown down the stumps and Ryan McLaren is gone. Great work from Dernbach charging in off the boundary, a low, flat throw connects and finally England do something right in the field
slower ball, back of a length, slugged to long on
full, just outside off and through to the keeper
low full toss swung out to deep cover
full length, inside edge into the pad, it runs towards point as they take a single
slower ball outside off, Steyn completely deceived and swings and misses outside off
slugged down to long off, they come back for two and this could be another run out but Kieswetter, gathering the throw, has three yards to throw the stumps down from and misses so another extra run

inn2.comm: pitched up outside off, swinging in a touch and left alone by Cook
back of a length, bit of room for Cook to swing his arms and he chops wide of deep backward point for a couple
length ball in the corridor outside off, left alone
left again, though this almost shaves the off bail on its way through. Steyn holds his head in his hands
length ball outside off, played back to the bowler coming forward

Steyn has struck, trapping Cook right in front of off stump! The ball pitched in line, snaked back in on that low trajectory that Steyn generates and rapped into the knee roll, pretty straightforward decision and, just like at West End, England lose their captain in the first over of their chase
back of a length, swinging down the leg side and tickled away off the thigh pad towards fine leg for a couple
slanted across on a length, goes back and chops into the ground towards point
wide again - too wide as Bell tries but fails to cut
angled across on a good length, over the wicket to the right-hander, left alone
better from Tsotsobe, scrambling the seam as the ball slides across Bell, who is beaten pushing forward outside off
short and wide but he gets away with it, Bell back cut intercepted by another panther pounce at point from Faf du Plessis
full and wide of the stumps, Bell shuffles over and then withdraws his bat
steams in, hits the seam back of a length and the ball spits and leaves Trott off the pitch, past the bat and through to de Villiers
full and on a straighter line, defended stoutly back down the pitch
short and outside the line of off, Trott gets out of the way
another rising delivery, angling in and then leaving Trott off the pitch, beaten again and he didn't look comfortable either
fuller length, outside off stump, pushed to cover on the front foot
slides down the leg side, that'll be a wide
length ball outside off stump and Trott square drives on the up, coolly done and the ball races away with all the pace of the Steyn Express to carry to for four
angled across Bell on a good length outside off, leaves it well alone
tighter to off stump, stays back and cuts in to the ground towards cover-point
on the pads, short of a length and diverted of hip/bum through backward square leg
length ball on the stumps, maybe coming back in a touch, blocked back to the bowler
full and wide and >widenailing a flat pull in front of the fielder at deep midwicket for four
attacks again, lofting this high, high, h-i-g-h over long-on before the ball plops into the outfield and Peterson pulls it in
tossed up outside off and patted to point
on the stumps, worked through midwicket
short of a length and wide, Bell rattles his wrists through a ferocious cut but only finds extra-cover
dragged down again and pulled forcefully out to deep square leg

out, given lbw on review! The ball was looped up on leg stump and Trott missed with a sweep, was hit on the pad but umpire Taufel shook his head to the initial appeal. South Africa turned to DRS and replays showed the delivery pitching in line and straightening enough to go on and hit leg stump
tossed up outside off stump and Bopara pushes his first ball towards cover-point comfortably enough
full and angled across, steps out and taps to mid-off
stays back and defends a short ball in front of the wicket
short and down the leg side, filthy delivery from Tsotsobe and Bell dish-rags it round the corner disdainfully for four to long leg
back of a length and wide of off, steered down to third man
scrambles the seam and drifts a length ball across Bopara, who pokes at it from the crease
tighter line, bends his back and digs the ball in, Bopara stays back and blocks
tossed up in line with leg stump, played back down the pitch
goes back and chips to point
bit of width again, hops into position and slashes through cover-point
floated up on leg stump, turned to midwicket
flat delivery, spins away from Bopara who jabs into a gap at cover and they hustle one
short of a length again, cut hard on the back foot but extra-cover tumbles to make the stop
back of a length, bit of width and Bopara hangs his bat out unsuccessfully as the ball fizzes through
pitched up full and straight, dabbed into the leg side
back of a length outside off and pulled through mid-on off the back foot, it bounces in front of Tsotsobe and skids away to the rope
pitched up on off stump, punched towards cover
banged in short, Bopara takes on the bouncer and manages to keep it down, hooking to long leg
length ball wide of the stumps, Bell swings an angled bat and deflects the ball on to his standing leg and away on the off side
full and wide, shaping back in through the air and Bopara plays over the top of the ball aiming for a big, booming cover drive
steps out and leaves a length ball in the corridor
another stock ball in the channel outside off, left alone
full and wide of the stumps - another to the total
prods outside off and edged through to the keeper! Bopara falls in single figures again, his ODI summer of two halves continuing with a tame shot to a length ball in the corridor outside off
leg-stump bouncer, climbs high as Morgan shapes to hook before pulling out
length ball on the legs, flicked in the air through square leg and Amla comes in off the boundary to field
speared through on a good length, left alone
short of a length, bit of width and Morgan cuts on the bounce to backward point
line and length outside off, Morgan watches this one by
short, outside the line of off, punched on the back foot to cover-point, Duminy has to go to his right to field and there's time for one
length delivery, wide of the stumps, back cut deftly for a single to third mna
vicious lifter, zoning in on the top of Morgan's block, he crouches and swipes at it but fails to connect
Bell continues to advance on the bigger boys, cutting fiercely through the covers but he'll only get one to the sweeper in the deep
pitched up on leg stump, jabbed to midwicket half forward
skips out and turns a full ball into a half-volley, spearing it back past the bowler to long-off
another superbly timed stroke, stepping forward and cushioning the ball wide of mid-on, won't quite get to the boundary but a top shot all the same
back of a length outside off, chopped towards point
short and outside the line again, played to point on the back foot
round the wicket, touch short and steered to point
back of a length again and this appears to stop in the pitch, Morgan lobs it short on the off side
length ball in the channel outside off, Morgan narrows the angle and then opens the face to steer a couple fine to third man
pitched up outside off, punched into the covers on the front foot
overpitched on leg stump and Morgan casually flips one to deep backward square leg
short of a length and speared across, Bell doesn't time his cut shot and it bobbles towards point along the ground
length ball, angled across, blocked
beaten outside off this time, hanging a lazy bat out from the crease
dug in short and tucked through the leg side on the pull
full and wide, Bell would need a telescopic handle hit that
dug in short outside off stump, slapped through the covers to the deep sweeper
pitched on a length, off-stump line, gets forward and punches to mid-off
back of a length, Morgan steps out and tries to cut, it's too close to him and he fails to connect
full and just outside off, dug out towards point
full toss and Bell goes to drive it and misses, doesn't evade the off stump by much
a swing outside off stump gets a wild edge over point and the cover sweeper comes round to field
length ball and it bounces a touch on Bell who guides it down square on the off side
forward and played up towards mid off, they take a sharp single
length ball, guided to point from the crease
nearly one straight up as Bell tries to lift one down the ground and gets an inside edge into his pad
played to midwicket who goes to his left to prevent the single
single this time though, played out off the back foot through cover
only just back of a length but Morgan goes right back in his crease, waits for it and hammers it past midwicket for four, excellent use of the crease
forward this time to flick to midwicket
down the wicket and clipped down to long on
full toss, clipped wide enough of midwicket for two towards the Allen stand
length ball around off stump, blocked towards point
little straighter and chipped past the vacant square leg region
forward, playing out to cover point
back of a length, Bell shuffles down and plays down to long leg
forward just outside off stump, played into the covers
length on middle stump, blocked on the crease

edged and caught behind, a good catch too from de Villiers. It was banged in short, Bell looked to slap it away on the off side, it might have bounced a touch more than he was bargaining for and Bell got a thin top edge and flew high to de Villiers who reached up with a right mitt and held on
full and straight, blocked coming forward
just outside off, back foot driven to point
fired in towards the pads, it runs to square leg and they take a leg bye
tucked softly into the leg side and they charge back for the second as deep backward square can't get in quickly enough
that will get it done quicker, blazing extra cover drive off the front foot, blistering strike and deep cover can't get there, four into the grandstand
and now a single down to third man taken off the back foot
fine save in the covers, uppish drive but well timed towards Amla who got down well to save with one hand with a dive to his left
back of a length on off stump, blocked staying in the crease
short and goes to pull from outside off, gets it to mid on
wide of off stump, ugly waft without moving the feet misses
down the wicket and slapped straight to mid off
step across the stump and a slower ball, which is too short, is helped down to long leg, simple adjustment and sweep around the corner
length outside off, blocked towards point
finds point again, this time a full ball dug out
down on one knee and slugged over mid on, Morgan shuffled outside off stump, got down low and hoiked it to long on
and this is four more, to long leg, again help on it's way to long leg, short and pulled away again
back of a length around off stump and dismissed through midwicket, whipped away, really well played, nicely timed and it races down the hill
short and outside off now, a wide
four more, this is very lucky though, a charge and a swing at a ball too quick for him, it flies straight over the keeper's head
leg stump, clipped out towards deep square leg, Amla slides and fields
and that is finished in regal fashion, a straight driven six over long off, takes some doing that off Dale Steyn but what a way to confirm a huge win, marvellous timing into the pavilion
